Question 158) A pharmaceutical company produces pill medications, each in the form of a cylinder with a semi -sphere with the same radius as the cylinder at each end. These pills are shaped by a programmed machine so that cylinders are always 10 mm long, adapting the radius according to the desired volume.
A medicine is produced in 5 mm radius pills. To facilitate swallowing, this medicine is desired by reducing the radius to 4 mm, and consequently its volume. This requires the reprogramming of the machine that produces these pills.
Use 3 as an approximate value for p.
The reduction in pill volume, in cubic millimeters, after the machine reprogramming, will be equal to
A) 168.
B) 304.
C) 306.
D) 378.
E) 514.
